results.title: The Icarus wish
results.brief_description: The awe of flight, the wonder of a bird, the freedom of riding a current of air. Multiple screen images condense the emotions of two boys of different cultures. A jet liner, a bird, a kite and a paper airplane are the segments of this non-verbal adventure in visual literacy.

results.title: Iberian Peninsula: Spain and Portugal
results.brief_description: A brief survey of modern Spain and Portugal showing the chief topographic and climatic features of th Peninsula, and portraying people at work in various types of agricultural pursuits and in fishing, mining and industry. Emphasises especially the Peninsula’s limited industrialisation and the age-old agricultural techniques generally employed in the region.

results.title: I wasn't scared
results.creator_credit: Giles Walker, Roman Kroitor, Vladimir Valenta and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Based upon a fictional story of suspense and drama, this film involves two school-children who come across an unexploded World War II bomb. The discovery awakens the curiosity of one child and the fear of the other. Designed to alert children to the various types of dangerous explosive devices they may find in Canada and be tempted to tamper with, the film clearly identifies the devices. To ensure the film’s effectiveness, the filmmaker presents the information in a highly dramatic format. Cast includes Todd Nixon, Debbie Viau, Les Carlson and Steve Pernie.

results.title: I want to work
results.creator_credit: D Lynton Porter, Vroni Gordon and Central Council for Health Education
results.brief_description: Deals with the problems faced by epileptics seeking employment. Traces the career of a teenage girl on the point of leaving school who finds she is not wanted in any position because she is an epileptic. Finally she joins the British Epileptic Association which helps her to find employment and provides fellowship by the sharing of a common problem.

results.title: I want to go to school
results.creator_credit: John Krish, Karel Reisz, Leon Clore, Graphic Films and National Union of Teachers
results.brief_description: An impression of a day at an average primary school. The main theme is the relationship which develops between child and teacher during early education. Sequences of classroom and individual instruction, improvised play acting, indoor and outdoor recreation, illustrate the well balanced curriculum provided. Intended to help parents towards an understanding of their children’s school activities.

results.title: I, the Aboriginal
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Kip Porteous and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Set in and around Darwin the film discloses the life of an Australian First Nations man as depicted in Douglas Lockwood’s book of the same name. Philip Roberts recalls his early years of tribal life and gradual acceptance by the white community. He receives medical training, and travels frequently to his own people making use of his knowledge.

results.title: I taught them but they didn't learn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Malcolm Smith, Sue Mogg and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Examines the attitudes which children from low socio-economic backgrounds bring to school. Teachers’ attitudes can affect children’s learning, so the attitudes of teachers are also examined. The intention of the film is to make teachers aware of the ‘culture gaps’ which can occur between groups of children.

results.title: IQ: questionable criterion
results.brief_description: Describes the procedures involved in a comprehensive diagnostic evaluation of a child with a learning problem. Shows specialists at work, some of the tests they administer, the culminating case conference, final diagnosis and recommended remedial program.

results.title: The IQ myth. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: An examination of the ways the IQ concept has been used and misused. It focuses on the question of how much importance should be placed on the test result. This can mean the difference between success or failure in school and adult life, and such exams have been used to categorise entire cultures and races as mentally inferior

results.title: I owe you
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage managers to consider their influence on the development of subordinate managers and supervisors. Highlights the dissatisfaction and frustrations aroused in subordinates when a manager overlooks their natural desire for development in their jobs. Describes the main points of an action plan devised to solve a work problem and improve subordinate skills.
